29333.name: Quick Status
29333.description:
Apply status indicators to your layers in a flash:


  • Work In Progress
  • Ready For Review
  • Requires Changes
  • Approved


All statuses can be set using plugin parameters or the handy Status Panel.


Assign a shortcut like `Ctrl + Option + S` to quickly access the status panel.


How To Use


  1. Select the items you want to apply a status to.
  2. Apply a status via the status panel or via plugin parameters
  3. Profit

29666.name: Avatar Generator
29666.description: Easily generate random avatars from https://avatars.dicebear.com/ with a simple plugin, customizing the size and quantity.

29611.name: Clapy.co - Storybook import & export (closed beta)
29611.description:
You are using Storybook and would like to share your components between Figma and Storybook? Create and maintain a unified Design System without the hassle by syncing Figma with your code:


  • Import Storybook components into Figma from a Storybook URL, so you can use the latest production-ready elements in your mockups.
  • Generate all variants from code in seconds, with the props you need.
  • Auto-layout is applied to imported components, if they are responsive in the source code.
  • Preview the final component in the plugin when you click on a component, to add context to your mockups.
  • (Soon) generate React code when updates are made to components in your Design System, so developers can focus on complex integrations with fewer repetitive tasks.


30 second demo video


â„¹ To access the closed beta, please join our Discord server or Slack server and head to the channel #get-early-access.


Find out more at https://clapy.co/

29078.name: Automatin
29078.description:
Automate your tasks with the Figma JavaScript library.


How to use it?

Just write your code as if you were coding a plugin, and click on "Run code".

You can find the documentation here: https://www.figma.com/plugin-docs/api/figma/.


Why?

Instead of creating a plugin for each small automation, you can now write it directly in Figma. This means that you no longer have to:

  • create a plugin from scratch, which can be redundant
  • download the Figma Desktop app (because to use the plugin online, the moderators have to give their permission)


The project is open-source. Find the code here: https://github.com/arthur-fontaine/automatin-for-figma/.

29400.name: Auto Layout Shortcuts
29400.description: Adds menu items for common auto layout commands so they can be assigned to keyboard shortcuts in your OS.

29679.name: Spatial Cube Artwork Generator
29679.description: The plugin allows you to generate abstract sharp shapes on the edges of a 3D cube. Basically, you will generate an architecture template for sketching or graphic design. You can customize the length and number of vector shapes. The more vector shapes you create, the more interesting the result, but this can affect performance.

28777.name: Brand Guardian
28777.description:
Brand Guardian is an AI driven platform that gives marketing, creative and production teams total content quality assurance at scale. This plugin connects Figma with Brand Guardian platform to enable a review process that will ensure the designs are on brand, inclusive and compliant.


To use this plugin you need a Brand Guardian account. If youâ€™re interested but donâ€™t have one yet, please contact us at obg@wundermanthompson.com.


How does it work? 

  1. Log into your Brand Guardian account. 
  2. Select part of the design you want to review. 
  3. Choose the Brand and Rule Collection for the design. 
  4. Submit the asset and wait for feedback. 


Contact information 

Email: obg@wundermanthompson.com 

Website: https://www.wundermanthompson.com/brand-guardian

29167.name: Status Changer
29167.description:
Status Changer allows you to easily change the name of the person in charge and the modified date on your own Component set.


HOW TO USE

  1. Install `Status Changer` and run it inside of a project.
  2. Edit the Component Set created for the Status bar.(Note whether the item has been added to Variants.)
  3. Select the Frames, etc. to which you want to add a status bar and run Status Changer.
  4. You can select your own customized component set values, and the status bar(s) will be added when you select and press the SET button.
  5. After changing the status, click "Change user name and modification time." from the plugin in the properties screen on the right.


About Dates and Dates

Multiple country formats are supported, including American and British, Asian, etc.


Sample For January 2, 2022 at 11:03 p.m.


For the British "DD/MM/YY H.mm a" 02/01/22 11.03 pm

For the U.S. "MM-DD-YY H:mm a" 01-02-22 11:03 pm

For the Japan "YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm" 2022/01/02 23:03

Click Here For More Info! 


Caution

Be sure to place it directly below the page.

Do not rename the properties.

relaunchButtons.name: Change user name and modification time

28099.name: Quick Setup
28099.description: Quick Setup will create a few pages to get your indie project started.

29780.name: Style Docs
29780.description:
A simple and quick plugin to help in creating style guide documentation.


Menu:

ON-SELECTED: runs on the selected texts/rectangles.

  1. Text : Provides font details like font name, size, weight, etc.,
  2. Rectangle : Provides RGB & Hex Color codes.


FROM-STYLES: runs from the saved Figma styles.

  1. Text Styles: Provides font details like font name, size, weight, etc.,
  2. Paint Styles: Provides RGB & Hex color codes.

ï»¿

Pre-requisites:

Un-group the rectangles/texts before running.

29590.name: Page markup
29590.description: Mark the page and switch to the page

29656.name: FireJet - React + TypeScript Export
29656.description:
[IN DEVELOPMENT] FireJet allows you to export to React + Typescript.


We aim to provide the best conversion in terms of:

  1. Pixel Perfect Outputs
  2. Responsive Outputs
  3. Human Readable Code


Right now its a work in progress, and it's not perfect, but we are doing our best to ensure the export experience is as seamless as possible! Do message us at founders@firejet.io if you encounter any bugs/have any suggestions


Usage:

  1. Launch the plugin
  2. Click on design in figma
  3. It will be converted into a file structure in the UI which you can directly copy and paste into your project


Paid Version:

We intend to have a paid version which allows heavy customisation of the code output, according to your best practices! Contact us at firejet.io for more details.

29466.name: Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level Calculator
29466.description:
Measure readability of your copy with this Flesch-Kincaid grade level calculator. Select a text layer, and then open the plug-in.


The Flesch Reading Ease Readability Formula is a general formula suitable for all kind of texts. It's especially great for:


  • Writing copy for your website
  • Writing copy for user interfaces
  • Advertising your product
  • Writing headlines and taglines
  • Producing terms and conditions that donâ€™t confuse
  • Boosting your SEO performance
  • Communicating your research to a non-specialist audience


Simply select copy with punctuation to receive your score.


Changelog

V0.1 - Initial Release

V0.2 - Added warning pop-up if all or some of copy selected does not have punctuation

29322.name: Webhook Configurator
29322.description:
Create & manage your team's webhooks.


You can...

  • create webhooks for teams
  • show a list of webhooks for your teams
  • remove webhooks


Requirements

  • To manage a team's webhooks you need to be at least an administrator for that team.
  • You need to have a "Personal Access Token" (within Figma go to your avatar -> settings)
  • The team ID of the team for which to manage webhooks (currently only accessible from the browser version)


Notes

  • This plugin will receive more features/updates.
  • Webhooks are currently in Beta.
  • I'm not a designer myself. So pardon me for the horrible cover art/icon ğŸ˜…


Having feedback or questions? Just let me know ğŸ™‚


==FAQ==


Where do i find my Team ID's?

  1. Open your browser and navigate to Figma.
  2. On the left side select the team (click on it's name; don't select a project)
  3. In the browser's URL bar you can find the Team ID. It is right behind "...team/". E.g. https://www.figma.com/files/team/1234567890/xxx?fuid=8934... => Team ID is 1234567890
29322.release_notes:
- All event types are supported (File update, file version update, file deletion, file comments, library publishing).
- The event type can be selected from a dropdown.
- Improved error handling: users are shown toasts with some instructions.
- If creating a hook fails users are not navigated away anymore.
- Code cleanup & minor UI improvements

29691.name: Holistic values
29691.description: Select any element and effortlessly check its width, height, font size, and line-height converted into REM units.
29691.release_notes: The option to calculate the Auto line-height value is added. Also, the bug with the calculated line-height value is fixed.

29440.name: Suggested Links
29440.description:
Generate links for your prototype based on your frame contents.


This experimental plugin is the result of an ongoing research project. It uses a probabilistic supervised classifier and an integer programming solver to suggest links for your prototype based on the frames' text content and color composition. As a result of its research status, errors can occur and unexpected results are common.


-----


> Note: This Figma plugin is part of a master thesis project titled "Assignment-Based Link Optimization in GUI Prototyping Using Incremental Supervised Classification" by Christoph A. Johns at German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI) and Aalto University. The project is supervised by Michael Barz and Antti Oulasvirta. You can find the source code for all parts of this application on GitHub ([classifier](https://github.com/christophajohns/suggested-links-classifier), [optimizer](https://github.com/christophajohns/suggested-links-optimizer), [plugin](https://github.com/christophajohns/suggested-links), [paper](https://github.com/christophajohns/gui-links-as-assignment)).

29565.name: Position
29565.description: Set position and constraints with margin to center or corners.

28529.name: weblate integration
28529.description:
a plugin that checks for strings on weblate (translation tool) so design copy is updated with all website relevant locale data.


it integrates weblate self-hosted API to quality check design texts on figma and suggest possible already translated strings.

29771.name: [ALPHA] Figma to Abstra converter
29771.description:
Use this plugin to create designs and copy them over directly to Abstra!


This is a closed alpha. If you want to know more please contact us.

29585.name: Devign
29585.description:
Export your figma design file to Devign and check inconsistencies with Code in seconds.


Auto-create design related bug tickets. Collaborate faster and easier within your team. Maximize User Experience.


ğŸŒ� www.devign.ai

âœ‰ï¸� hello@deepbluedot.io

ğŸ“Œ To download Devign, please contact us.


Join our slack : https://bit.ly/devign_slack_invite
